coverFootnote.value:
FRAME is CE marked.
FRAME is not yet approved for sale in the US.

coverTagLine.value:
EXTERNAL SUPPORT
FOR PERIPHERAL BYPASS & RECONSTRUCTION PROCEDURES

screen1Body.value: Veins are the preferred conduits for peripheral bypass and arterial reconstruction procedures. However, the inherent structural limitations of vein grafts coupled with the hemodynamics of the arterial circulation, result in pathological remodeling and graft failure. When used in lower limb bypass, approximately 20% of vein grafts are occluded at 12 months (1) and 30%-50% will fail within 3-5 years (2) .

screen1Footnote1.value: Conte MS et al. Impact of increasing comorbidity on infrainguinal reconstruction: a 20-year perspective. Ann Surg 2001 Mar; 233(3):445-452.

screen1Footnote2.value: Conte ms et al. Results of prevent iii: a multicenter, randomized trial of edifoligide for the prevention of vein graft failure in lower extremity bypass surgery. J vasc surg 2006; 43:742-51; discussion: 751.

screen3Body.value:
FRAME is used in a variety of procedures to support vein grafts: Fem-pop and Fem-distal bypass.
Popliteal aneurysm repair.
In-situ bypass (over vein mobilized segments).
Suitable for both varicose and regular veins.

screen4Bullet1.value: Simple to apply without affecting standard practice

screen4Bullet3.value: A variety of models compatible with veins 3.5-8.0 mm in diameter

screen4Bullet4.value: Easley adjusted to perfectly fit the graft length

screen4Bullet6.value: Completely kink resistant – protects vein grafts from kinking

screen5Image1Subtitle.value: Popliteal aneurysm repair Vein graft before app...

screen7Bullet3.value: Can be adjusted to perfectly fit the graft length
